text:
Hi. 

Has anyone encountered this {  <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/issues/802> } issue in the last days, or has any idea if anyone fixed it?
I did a test in which I ran 3 validating peers with pbft consensus once with DEBUG level and once without and saw an expected behavior. 

I think it's not relevant anymore, can anyone disprove?

attachments.title: Log level does not  follow the defination in openchain.yaml · Issue #802 · hyperledger/fabric · GitHub
attachments.text: The latest master code (commit ee4056e) does not follow log level definition in openchain.yaml. Here is part of definition of the openchain.yaml: peer: error crypto: error status: warn...
attachments.fallback: GitHub: Log level does not  follow the defination in openchain.yaml · Issue #802 · hyperledger/fabric

text: @yavcom,  can't comment on your exact question since i'm always running with log_level=debug  but  for pbft to work, you need a minimum of 4 peers
that's if you want to tolerate one byzantine peer
can't it run with 2 peers if f=0?
it could but you're not taking advantage of pbft
you need pbft anyway to reach consensus
I was just doing it for the sake of the test of the log level
in the issue they used pbft, so did I.
BTW, has anyone tried running 'behave -t "@issue_680" ' ? It fails on timeout, is that a known issue?
<@U0ZJZBJLF>: that test fails on me near constantly, I think it is timing sensitive (and I have older machines)

For 680, also see <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/issues/793#issuecomment-210861227>. It doesn’t fail for me, but if anyone would like to submit a PR to increase the timeout it would be appreciated
